description: Mac Integration Basics is an excellent starting point for people working with Macintosh systems in a networked environment. The certification covers topics like integrating Mac and Windows PCs as well as connecting to numerous network services. Viewers who pass the Mac Integration Basics exam will be awarded the Apple Certified Associate certification.
name: Mac Integration Basics 10.11
subtitle: El Capitan 10.11

episodes.description: In this segment, Daniel and Don give a general overview of what you can expect in the upcoming episodes. They cover what the show's about, the target audience, what will be covered overall, and other topics.
episodes.title: Overview

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Don explain and demonstrate how to connect Mac computers to Directory Services. They start by explaining the concept of Directory Services. Then they show you how to create an OpenDirectory Server and connect a Mac client. Finally, they show you how to connect a Mac client to a Windows Active Directory Domain server.
episodes.title: Directory Servers

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Don explain file sharing while using a Mac client in a mixed environment. They begin by explaining the two ways in which you will commonly share files; connecting to a network file server and personal file sharing. They describe the different protocols used when connecting a network file share and then demonstrate those connections. Finally, they demonstrate setting up personal file sharing from your Mac.
episodes.title: File Sharing

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Don explore the collaboration software available to you in Mac OS X. Here they show you how to connect your Mac to a variety of different email services such as iCloud, Microsoft Exchange, or even AOL. They also show you connecting to other services that provide contacts and calendar access from multiple devices.
episodes.title: Collaboration Software

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Don demonstrate some of the great security features that are apart of the Mac operating system, so that you can support them inside of your mixed environments. They start by looking at the System Integration Protection(SIP) that "sandboxes" access to the system. Then they show you how to  utilize the Password Assistant to help you create secure passwords. Finally, they explain how to use 2-factor/multi-factor authentication for even greater user security.
episodes.title: Security Features

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Don continue their tour of the Mac OS security features. They start by showing you how to enable the screen locking with password feature. Then they demonstrate how to disable automatic login and finally, they look at drive encryption with FileVault 2.
episodes.title: Security Features Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Don finish looking at security features in the Mac OS. They pick back up by showing you how to enable a firmware password which will protect from unauthorized hardware access. Then they explain the importance of using antivirus systems like Sophos AV. Finally they walk you through interacting with the Gatekeeper and the OS X Firewall.
episodes.title: Security Features Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Don explain the many different ways to connect your Mac to a printer. They begin with the most simplistic method of connecting via USB. Then they show you how to connect to a network printer using AirPrint as well as directly using TCP/IP. Finally they look at connecting to a shared printer on a Windows system and sharing your printer from your Mac.
episodes.title: Printing

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Don show you how to configure your Mac to allow for instant messaging. They start by demonstrating how to configure chat from Mac to Mac with AOL Instant Messenger, Yahoo, Google, and Bonjour. Then they show you how to setup a chat server using Jabber messaging built-in to the Server App.
episodes.title: Instant Messaging

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Don tackle the scenario of migrating a user and their data from a Windows based PC to a Mac. They show you how to use the Migration Assistant that is built-in to El Capitan to automate the process of finding and moving user data over a network connection.
episodes.title: Migrating from Windows

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Don discuss the importance of backing up your data. They demonstrate backing up using Time Machine to a removable hard drive, or a network share. They also discuss alternative backup solutions that may be useful.
episodes.title: Time Machine

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Don discuss the challenges of using Windows applications on a Mac. Here they show you a few ways that will help you attain compatibility between the two systems. These workarounds include employing Mac equivalent software, using 3rd-party compatibility tools, and running virtualization software like VMware Fusion.
episodes.title: Running Windows Applications

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Don discuss the challenges of using Windows applications with Mac hardware. Here they show you how to get around this problem by utilizing the Boot Camp feature of OS X which allows you to install the Windows operating system along side of Mac OS X. They take you from start to finish of preparing, configuring, installing, and post-install features of Boot Camp.
episodes.title: Boot Camp
